Package de.dhbw.ravensburg.zuul.ui

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
de.dhbw.ravensburg.zuul.ui.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
CreatureSprite, ItemSprite
public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
Rendering visual objects, like items, creatures and of course the player.
Author:
Frederick Dammeier

    • drawRotatedImage

      private void drawRotatedImage​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, javafx.scene.image.Image image, double angle, double tlpx, double tlpy)
      from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18260421/how-to-draw-image-rotated-on-javafx-canvas Draws an image on a graphics context. The image is drawn at (tlpx, tlpy) rotated by angle pivoted around the point: (tlpx + image.getWidth() / 2, tlpy + image.getHeight() / 2)
      Parameters:
      gc - the graphics context the image is to be drawn on.
      angle - the angle of rotation.
      tlpx - the top left x co-ordinate where the image will be plotted (in canvas co-ordinates).
      tlpy - the top left y co-ordinate where the image will be plotted (in canvas co-ordinates).

    • rotate

      private void rotate​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double angle, double px, double py)
      from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18260421/how-to-draw-image-rotated-on-javafx-canvas Sets the transform for the GraphicsContext to rotate around a pivot point.
      Parameters:
      gc - the graphics context the transform to applied to.
      angle - the angle of rotation.
      px - the x pivot co-ordinate for the rotation (in canvas co-ordinates).
      py - the y pivot co-ordinate for the rotation (in canvas co-ordinates).
